function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Deforestation increases the prevalence of the malaria vector, leading to a higher risk of malaria transmission.","Impact":"Increased cases of malaria and public health implications in the affected areas.","Mitigation":"Implement reforestation programs and sustainable land use practices to reduce deforestation and control the spread of malaria vectors.","Technologies":"Satellite imaging for monitoring land use, GIS for land-use planning, and agroforestry techniques for sustainable land management.","People":"Population living in areas affected by deforestation and increased malaria risk.","Owner":"Government agencies, environmental organizations, and local communities."},{"Description":"Increased rainfall leads to increased prevalence of the Anopheles vector, resulting in a greater need for malaria control strategies.","Impact":"Rapid spread of malaria and increased public health burden in regions with heightened precipitation.","Mitigation":"Implement vector control measures, such as insecticide-treated bed nets and indoor residual spraying, to reduce the proliferation of Anopheles mosquitoes.","Technologies":"Insecticide-treated bed nets, indoor residual spraying equipment, and GIS for identifying high-risk areas.","People":"Population residing in regions prone to increased rainfall and higher prevalence of malaria vectors.","Owner":"Health agencies, local governments, and community health organizations."},{"Description":"Data paucity and lack of actionable insights hinder the characterization of the magnitude and complexity of the malaria problem, particularly in the context of climate change and urbanization.","Impact":"Inadequate understanding of the malaria risk factors and the challenges in developing effective intervention strategies.","Mitigation":"Support interdisciplinary research and data collection to improve the understanding of malaria risk factors and their interdependencies, especially in the context of climate change and urbanization. Foster collaboration between public health and built environment experts.","Technologies":"Big data analytics, remote sensing technology, and interdisciplinary research collaborations for comprehensive data collection and analysis.","People":"Researchers, public health professionals, and urban planners involved in understanding and addressing malaria risk factors.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health agencies, and urban planning departments."}]}
